New Records: LeBron James became the first player in NBA history to appear in a game in his teens and 40s
Key Match Events: Cavaliers led 96-80 less than three minutes into the fourth quarter before Lakers started to rally
Lakers got within 112-107 before Cavaliers closed the game on a 10-3 run
Allen's dunk with 1:58 remaining gave Cleveland a 116-107 advantage
Post-Match Reflections: LeBron James expressed pride in his team's effort after the comeback win
Cavaliers coach highlighted the victory as a crucial step toward the championship
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cavaliers made 18 3-pointers, the seventh straight game they have had at least that many from beyond the arc
Cavaliers enter the new year with an NBA-best 29-4 record, including a 9-0 against the Western Conference
Lakers go into 2025 with an 18-14 mark, seventh in the Western Conference
Others: Sam Merrill sprained his right ankle during the second quarter and did not return
Darius Garland had a season-high 14 assists
Dorian Finney-Smith and Shake Milton made their Los Angeles debuts after being acquired in a trade with Brooklyn on Monday
